User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; rv:8.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/8.0.1
Build ID: 20111120135848

Steps to reproduce:

Open a web page which had an invalid SSL certificate (http://comixed.memebase.com/)


Actual results:

Firefox gave a popup which said the certificate is valid for only the following sites. The list was HUGE. I use Snow leopard, so the popup is the normal slide-down menu from top of the window. The buttons on the popup were outside my laptop screen. I had to blindly tab and hit return to make the popup disappear.


Expected results:

The text should have been cut off at some point, showing the buttons on screen. Perhaps there could be scrollbars attached on the popup, or if macs dont allow that, then perhaps a link/button for more details.
